DAZ Studio Deprecated File I/O

The DAZ Studio Scene File format (.daz) is a block-style binary format that is designed around the concept of object serialization. Because of this, the file format is completely flexible. New types of objects added to DAZ Studio via plug-in can readily be saved out and read back in without DAZ Studio needing to know anything about the object.

In object serialization, each object must save and load its own data from the file. This means that DAZ Studio itself does not read or write files at all - each object is responsible for saving and loading its own data. DAZ Studio simply tells the DzScene object to save itself; it saves its data, and in turn, tells each of its components to save their data, and so on.

In the DAZ Studio SDK, the only class that participates in serialization is DzBase. In order to save data to file, an object must inherit from DzBase. There are two classes that actually implement the object serialization and simplify writing and reading various data types: DzInFile, and DzOutFile. DzBase derived objects use these two classes to do the actual saving or loading from the file.
